importantDates.descriptionOfWhyDateIsRelevant: The date of the balcony collapse incident, which led to injuries and ongoing investigations, is significant as it marks a recent event impacting public safety and student welfare in Cincinnati.

importantTimeframes.descriptionOfWhyTimeFrameIsRelevant: The incident occurred in the evening, during a time when students were likely celebrating after exams, increasing the human impact and public concern about structural safety in student housing.

keyTakeAways: A balcony on the third floor of a building near the University of Cincinnati collapsed on Friday evening, resulting in 10 people being hospitalized.
One person was in critical condition, five had serious injuries, and four had minor injuries.
The building is a residence for many students, and the collapse occurred during a period of student celebration after a major exam.
Officials are investigating the cause of the collapse, with the Cincinnati Police Department and Cincinnati Fire Department leading the response.
The exact number of people on the balcony at the time of collapse is still unknown.

summaryOfNewsArticle: A balcony on the third floor of a building near the University of Cincinnati collapsed on Friday evening, resulting in 10 people being hospitalized. One person is in critical condition, five have serious injuries, and four have minor injuries. The building is a student residence, and the incident occurred during a celebration after a major exam. Officials from the Cincinnati Police Department and Cincinnati Fire Department are investigating the cause of the collapse. The exact number of people on the balcony at the time of the incident remains unknown.
title: Balcony Collapse at University of Cincinnati Building Leaves 10 Hospitalized
